result.execSummary:
The defendant Estevan A Trinidad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court has made a finding of indigency - court costs and DNA surcharge are waived.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.  Defendant Estevan A Trinidad in court with attorney Dirk Jensen.  Defendant Estevan A Trinidad in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Revocation packet received.  STATE RECOMMENDATION:  6 months RCJ.  DEFENSE:  poss THC.  AODA issues / cognitive thinking.  4-5 months RCJ.  Defendant makes statement to the court.  
BTC:  6 months RCJ, CFTS.  Payment plan of $25/mo, 1st payment due 3/1/15 to pay remaining costs, missed payment or FTP 30 days RCJ.
Letters on behalf of def
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  
***AMENDED 5-20-2014: GPS MONITORING IS TERMINATED.  DEFENDANT IS STILL UNDER HOME DETENTION.  EXCEPTIONS ARE SCHOOL, COURT, ATTORNEY APPOINTMENTS AND WORK.***
 It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting with atty, and going to school.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Estevan A Trinidad in court with attorney Domingo S Cruz.  James D Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Defense moves to remove GPS.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod granted to remove GPS.
ZCI
